data.title: Summarizing Books with Human Feedback
data.description: Scaling human oversight of AI systems for tasks that are difficult to evaluate.

data.title: Helen Toner Joins OpenAI’s Board of Directors
data.description:
Today, we’re excited to announce the appointment of Helen Toner to our Board of
Directors. As the Director of Strategy at Georgetown’s Center for Security and
Emerging Technology (CSET), Helen has deep expertise in AI policy and global AI
strategy research. This appointment advances our dedication to the

data.title: OpenAI Codex
data.description:
We’ve created an improved version of OpenAI Codex, our AI system that translates
natural language to code, and we are releasing it through our API in private
beta starting today. Codex is the model that powers GitHub Copilot
[https://copilot.github.com/], which we built and launched in partnership

data.title: Introducing Triton: Open-Source GPU Programming for Neural Networks
data.description:
We're releasing Triton 1.0, an open-source Python-like programming language
which enables researchers with no CUDA experience to write highly efficient GPU
code—most of the time on par with what an expert would be able to produce.
Triton makes it possible to reach peak hardware performance with relatively
little

data.title: Improving Language Model Behavior by Training on a Curated Dataset
data.description: Our latest research finds we can improve language model behavior with respect to specific behavioral values by fine-tuning on a small, curated dataset.

data.title: OpenAI Startup Fund
data.description: The OpenAI Startup Fund is investing $100 million to help AI companies have a profound, positive impact on the world.

data.title: OpenAI Scholars 2021: Final Projects
data.description:
We’re proud to announce that the 2021 class of OpenAI Scholars
[http://openai.com/scholars] has completed our six-month mentorship program and
have produced an open-source research project with stipends and support from
OpenAI.

Working alongside leading OpenAI researchers that created GPT-3 and DALL·E, our
Scholars explored topics

data.title: Will Hurd Joins OpenAI’s Board of Directors
data.description: We’re delighted to announce that Congressman Will Hurd has joined our board of directors.

data.title: GPT-3 Powers the Next Generation of Apps
data.description: Over 300 applications are delivering GPT-3–powered search, conversation, text completion, and other advanced AI features through our API.

data.title: Multimodal Neurons in Artificial Neural Networks
data.description: We’ve discovered neurons in CLIP that respond to the same concept whether presented literally, symbolically, or conceptually.

data.title: Scaling Kubernetes to 7,500 Nodes
data.description:
We've scaled Kubernetes clusters to 7,500 nodes, producing a scalable
infrastructure for large models like GPT-3 [https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.14165], 
CLIP [https://openai.com/blog/clip/], and DALL·E
[https://openai.com/blog/dall-e/], but also for rapid small-scale iterative
research such as Scaling Laws for Neural

data.title: DALL·E: Creating Images from Text
data.description: We’ve trained a neural network called DALL·E that creates images from text captions for a wide range of concepts expressible in natural language.

data.title: CLIP: Connecting Text and Images
data.description: We’re introducing a neural network called CLIP which efficiently learns visual concepts from natural language supervision.

data.title: Organizational Update from OpenAI
data.description:
It’s been a year of dramatic change and growth at OpenAI. In May, we introduced
GPT-3—the most powerful language model to date—and soon afterward launched our
first commercial product, an API to safely access artificial intelligence models
using simple, natural-language prompts. We’re proud of these and

data.title: OpenAI at NeurIPS 2020
data.description: Live demos and discussions at our virtual booth.

data.title: OpenAI Licenses GPT-3 Technology to Microsoft
data.description:
OpenAI released its first commercial product back in June: an API
[https://openai.com/blog/openai-api/] for developers to access advanced technologies
for building new applications and services. The API features a powerful general
purpose language model, GPT-3 [https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.14165], and has
received tens of thousands

data.title: Learning to Summarize with Human Feedback
data.description:
We've applied reinforcement learning from human feedback to train language
models that are better at summarization. Our models generate summaries that are
better than summaries from 10x larger models trained only with supervised
learning. Even though we train our models on the Reddit TL;DR dataset, the same
models transfer

data.title: OpenAI Scholars 2020: Final Projects
data.description: Our third class of OpenAI Scholars presented their final projects at virtual Demo Day, showcasing their research results from over the past five months.

data.title: Image GPT
data.description: We find that, just as a large transformer model trained on language can generate coherent text, the same exact model trained on pixel sequences can generate coherent image completions and samples.

data.title: OpenAI API
data.description:
We’re releasing an API for accessing new AI models developed by OpenAI. Unlike
most AI systems which are designed for one use-case, the API today provides a
general-purpose “text in, text out” interface, allowing users to try it on
virtually any English language task. You can now request access

data.title: Procgen and MineRL Competitions
data.description:
We’re excited to announce that OpenAI is co-organizing two NeurIPS 2020
competitions with AIcrowd [https://www.aicrowd.com], Carnegie Mellon University
[https://www.cmu.edu/], and DeepMind [https://deepmind.com/], using Procgen
Benchmark [https://openai.com/blog/procgen-benchmark/] and MineRL
[http://minerl.io]. We rely heavily on these environments

data.title: AI and Efficiency
data.description:
We’re releasing an analysis showing that since 2012 the amount of compute needed
to train a neural net to the same performance on ImageNet classification has
been decreasing by a factor of 2 every 16 months. Compared to 2012, it now takes
44 times less compute to train a

data.title: Jukebox
data.description: We’re introducing Jukebox, a neural net that generates music, including rudimentary singing, as raw audio in a variety of genres and artist styles. We’re releasing the model weights and code, along with a tool to explore the generated samples.

data.title:
Improving Verifiability
in AI Development
data.description:
We’ve contributed to a multi-stakeholder report by 58 co-authors at 30
organizations, including the Centre for the Future of Intelligence
[http://lcfi.ac.uk/], Mila [https://mila.quebec/en/], Schwartz Reisman
Institute
for Technology and Society [https://sr-institute.utoronto.ca/], Center for
Advanced Study in the Behavioral Sciences [https:

data.title: OpenAI Microscope
data.description: We’re introducing OpenAI Microscope, a collection of visualizations of every significant layer and neuron of eight vision “model organisms” which are often studied in interpretability.

data.title: OpenAI Standardizes on PyTorch
data.description:
We are standardizing OpenAI’s deep learning framework on PyTorch
[https://pytorch.org/]. In the past, we implemented projects in many frameworks
depending on their relative strengths. We’ve now chosen to standardize to make
it easier for our team to create and share optimized implementations of our
models.



As

data.title: Deep Double Descent
data.description:
We show that the double [https://arxiv.org/abs/1812.11118] descent
[https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.03667] phenomenon [https://arxiv.org/abs/1809.09349] 
occurs in CNNs, ResNets, and transformers: performance first improves, then gets
worse, and then improves again with increasing model size, data size, or
training time.

data.title: Procgen Benchmark
data.description: We’re releasing Procgen Benchmark, 16 simple-to-use procedurally-generated environments which provide a direct measure of how quickly a reinforcement learning agent learns generalizable skills.

data.title: Safety Gym
data.description: We're releasing Safety Gym, a suite of environments and tools for measuring progress towards reinforcement learning agents which respect safety constraints while training.

data.title: GPT-2: 1.5B Release
data.description: As the final model release of GPT-2’s staged release, we’re releasing the largest version (1.5B parameters) of GPT-2 along with code and model weights to facilitate detection of outputs of GPT-2 models.
